dungeon.command

Class CommandManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeon.command.CommandManager

  • public class CommandManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The CommandManager class defines the list of all the different commands available in the game, as well as those available in the current room of the dungeon. All the commands currently added to the game are defined as static strings in order to be accessible anywhere in the program.
    Author:
    lucasmouradeoliveira

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandManager(Dungeon dungeon)
      Creates a new command manager, which determines all the possible commands, and those currently available to the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Command getAvailableCommand(java.lang.String action)
      Returns a command from the list of currently available commands.
      void setAvailableCommands(java.util.List<java.lang.String> availableActions)
      Picks from the list of possible commands all the commands matching the name of the list and adds them to the currently available commands.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandManager

        public CommandManager(Dungeon dungeon)
        Creates a new command manager, which determines all the possible commands, and those currently available to the user.
        Parameters:
        dungeon - the dungeon in which all the commands are being used.

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableCommand

        public Command getAvailableCommand(java.lang.String action)
        Returns a command from the list of currently available commands.
        Parameters:
        action - the name of the command
        Returns:
        the command if it can be found in the list of currently available commands, null otherwise.

      • setAvailableCommands

        public void setAvailableCommands(java.util.List<java.lang.String> availableActions)
        Picks from the list of possible commands all the commands matching the name of the list and adds them to the currently available commands.
        Parameters:
        availableActions - the names of the commands to search in the global command list.
